segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, and it’s actually kind of beautiful.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way it cascades down the cabinet doors looks almost artistic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will notice before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are so focused on the cookies, they don’t even see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find it funny how oblivious everyone is to the water.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the calm outside and the chaos inside is striking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but smile at how ridiculous this whole situation is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s determination to get that cookie is almost admirable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think this scene would make a great painting—so much happening at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The way the light comes through the window makes everything feel so alive.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m really enjoying observing all these little details.
segments.speaker: PAR
